refnamediv.refpurpose: returns a string with list of errors detected by DTD validator on reading given XML document

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This parses the argument, which is expected to be an XML fragment (possibly with syntax errors, violations of validity conditions etc.) and returns a human-readable list of errors as a string. DTD validation may be performed during any reading of XML source in functions xml_tree(), xml_persistent() or xper_doc(), so that an application may check XML source on the fly; severe constraint violations in source XML will be signalled as SQL runtime errors.

refsect2.title: document
refsect2.para: XML or HTML document to check

refsect2.title: parser_mode
refsect2.para: 0 or 1; 0 - XML parser mode 1 - HTML parser mode

refsect2.title: base_uri
refsect2.para: in HTML parser mode change all absolute references to relative from given base_uri (http://<host>:<port>/<path>)

refsect2.title: content_encoding
refsect2.para: string with content encoding type of <document>; valid are 'ASCII', 'ISO', 'UTF8', 'ISO8859-1', 'LATIN-1' etc., defaults are 'UTF-8' for XML mode and 'LATIN-1' for HTML mode

refsect2.title: content_language
refsect2.para: string with language tag of content of <document>; valid names are listed in IETF RFC 1766, default is 'x-any' (it means 'mix of words from various human languages)

refsect2.title: dtd_validator_config
refsect2.para: configuration string of the validator, default is empty string meaning that only critical errors should be reported. See Configuration Options of the DTD Validator for details.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: Human readable list of errors if applicable as a varchar.
